page.title: 02WABERTHWAITE CHURCH
page.content: The church of St.John is situated in the hamlet of Hall Waberthwaite on the south bank of the Esk estuary. The church is a plain rectangular building of early Norman design built in the twelfth century. There is an ancient sandstone cross shaft in the graveyard The churchyard contains many species of unusual wild flowers, and is especially attractive in Spring when the crocuses and daffodils are in flower. The church is part of the combined parish of Eskdale, Irton, Muncaster and Waberthwaite. Services are held every fortnight, Matins and Holy Communion alternating.The Book of Common Prayer is in regular use for these. Activities,including a garden open day and a sponsored entry in the London Marathon,have helped to raise money towards the appeal for a new roof and internal refurbishment.
